H0.text: name the tissue type of the inner most layer of cells. Mesothelium

H1.text: name the tissue type of the inner most layer of cells. Endothelium

H2.text: name the tissue type of the inner most layer of cells. Parenchyma

H3.text: name the tissue type of the inner most layer of cells. Epithelium

A4.text: Epithelial tissue lines both the outside (skin) and the inside cavities and lumina of bodies.

A5.text: The lining of the blood and lymphatic vessels are of a specialised form of epithelium called endothelium.

A6.text: Simple squamous epithelium of the glomerulus (kidney).

A7.text: Stratified squamous epithelium of the vagina.

A8.text: The endothelium (pl. : endothelia) is a single layer of squamous endothelial cells that line the interior surface of blood vessels and lymphatic vessels.

A9.text: Endothelial cells have unique functions that include fluid filtration, such as in the glomerulus of the kidney, blood vessel tone, hemostasis, neutrophil recruitment, and hormone trafficking.
